artist: Natori Shunsen; Published by Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: mica on background; head and shoulders of man in profile from PR, holding a green and blue bowl in his PR hand; black kimono with white flower on PR sleeve; shiny silver ground
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
text: Thirty-second design of a set of 36. Imagined portrait of the actor Bandō Jūzaburō III (1886-1954) as the sumo wrestler Mizuhiki Seigorō who will change his name to Kuryūzan Namiemon 九龍山浪右衛門. The scene should be Shinagawa Shimazakirō 品川島崎楼 of the play Kami no megumi wagō no torikumi 神明恵和合取組 (The Spirit of Megumi, a Match in Harmony), commonly called "Megumi no kenka" or "The Megumi Feud". The performance this relates to might have been in Osaka.
title: The Actor Bandō Jūzaburō III as Mizuhiki Seigorō
